item.title: Bulletin updated at 13:16 HKT 16/10/2022
item.description:
At 1 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 29 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 45 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 4
Intensity of UV radiation : moderate

Tropical Cyclone Nesat entered the northeastern part of the South China Sea this morning. Besides, a replenishment of the northeast monsoon reached southern China. According to the latest forecast track, Nesat will edge closer to the coast of Guangdong tomorrow (17 October) at a distance of around 400 kilometres from Hong Kong. As compared with the previous forecast, Nesat will be closer to the Pearl River Estuary and will also be more intense. The Observatory will consider issuing the Standby Signal, No. 1 tonight. Under the combined effect of the northeast monsoon and Nesat, it will be windy over the territory in the next two days. Northerly winds will be strong offshore, reaching gale force on high ground. People engaged in outdoor work, water sports or hiking should take note of weather changes. The weather will be cooler on Tuesday (18 October) and Wednesday (19 October), with temperatures falling to around 19 degrees in the urban areas, and a couple of degrees lower in the New Territories. The Observatory will closely monitor the development of Nesat.

Please be reminded that:
The Fire Danger Warning is Red and the fire risk is extreme.
